item.description:
Tonight is one of the last fair weather waterfires. Tonight's special events include Opera singers along the river and a art/craft fair on Steeple Street until 10pm.

Come out and spend some time with friends on the South Main Street green.   This will be casual. Show up when you can.  It would be great if you brought some food to share (think sharing with 6 or so people), but fine if you bring nothing and ate before.  Definitely bring: wine or beer to share (1 bottle or six pack), a lawn chair, or a blanket. It is best to drive up South Main to the park, unload your stuff, and then find someplace legal to park (up the hill toward Brown is a good place to look).  I'll supply some water, plastic cups, some wine, a few extra lawn chairs, and some basic food.

South Main Street Park is not shown correctly on the map above.   South Main Street Park is directly across from the courthouse, next to Hemingway's seafood restaurant, and is the site of the waterfire gargoyles and stars.  If you know where they hang these from trees, then you know the right park:

Look for a green and white fisherman's bouy like these (but not exactly):
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a green and white fisherman's bouy next to lawn chairs.
item.name: Tonight! - Waterfire Tailgate
